intro: Aulomyrcia dumosa, commonly known as the hairy broom. It is a flowering plant native to the southern United States, particularly Texas and New Mexico. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Aulomyrcia dumosa is adapted to arid environments and has a low-growing, shrub-like appearance.
